hints.content:
We can think of $\purpleC{189}$ as $\purpleC{1\text{ hundred}}$, $\purpleC{8\text{ tens}}$, and $\purpleC{9 \text{ ones}}$.  

We can think of $\blueD{608}$ as $\blueD{6\text{ hundreds}}$  and $\blueD{8\text{ ones}}$.

$\phantom{=}\purpleC{189}+\blueD{608}$

$=\purpleC{1\text{ hundred}}+\purpleC{8\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{9\text{ ones}}+\blueD{6\text{ hundreds}}+\blueD{8\text{ ones}}$

$= \purpleC{1\text{ hundred}}+\blueD{6\text{ hundreds}}+\purpleC{8\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{9\text{ ones}}+\blueD{8\text{ ones}}$
The answer: $1\text{ hundred} + 6\text{ hundreds} + 8 \text{ tens}+9 \text{ ones}+8 \text{ ones}$

question.content:
Mike isn't sure how to add $189+608$.

**Help Mike by choosing an addition problem that is  the same as $189+608$.**
